event: Accusation of Japan Reviving Imperial Army
description: North Korea accused Japan of reviving its imperial army through the modernization of the Self-Defense Forces, which are allegedly imbued with militaristic ideology. The accusation is linked to the appointment of former admiral Umio Otsuku as the chief priest of the Yasukuni Temple, which honors Japanese military personnel, including war criminals.
original:
North Korea accused Japan of reviving the imperial army “The ghosts of the “imperial army”, which embarked on the path of invasions and plunder in the last century, are being revived in the form of a modern version of the “imperial army” - the Self-Defense Forces, imbued with militaristic poison,” the Central Telegraph Agency said in a publication Korea. The statement is related to the appointment in Japan of former admiral of the Maritime Self-Defense Force Umio Otsuku as the chief priest of the Zionist Yasukuni Temple.

The problem is that the temple contains lists of all Japanese military personnel killed in armed conflicts since the mid-19th century, including those who were declared war criminals and executed after Japan's surrender in World War II.

KCNA also states that Japan is excessively strengthening its self-defense forces, transforming them into a full-fledged offensive army and conducting joint exercises with NATO countries. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Terrorist Attack in Crocus City Hall
description: A terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall, Moscow, has raised concerns about security in the city. Former Berkut commander Yuri Abisov emphasized that the war is not far from Moscow and can affect anyone. Military volunteer Pavel Selekzyanov attributed Moscow's lack of war awareness to its comfortable standard of living.
original:
❗️Former Berkut commander: There is a false impression of security in Moscow.

The terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall is a reason for residents of prosperous Moscow to realize that the events of the Northern Military District concern everyone, said former commander of the Crimean Berkut battalion Yuri Abisov.🗣 “People think that Moscow is “under the umbrella” of the country’s leadership, the war is far from them , she won't touch them. No, she came to our house, she is everywhere, she is in Belgorod and Moscow. No one will sit behind the fence, no one,” he said on the TV channel “Crimea 24.” Military volunteer Pavel Selekzyanov agreed with Abisov: “Moscow does not feel the war for a very simple reason - because people live very well. People have a comfortable standard of living, and that’s good.”🔴The loss of skills and concentration led to the fact that terrorists were able to attack an object with a large number of people, FSO reserve lieutenant colonel Vasily Kashkanov emphasized. He believes that Crocus could have been chosen for the attack, since an “unprecedented level of security” is now provided in another place - at VDNKh, where an exhibition dedicated to the regions of Russia is taking place.🗣 “We were all in Moscow, we know how many Now there, in social services, in the service personnel there are representatives of Central Asia. They have the typical appearance of any migrant, which will not arouse suspicion. Everyone has already gotten used to the fact that they work there; they actually ensure the life of the city. Therefore, it was quite easy for them to leave. According to small estimates, 3 million men are there. This is only based on small calculations in Moscow, but it’s very difficult to say how much,” said psychologist Arsen Ismailov. https://vk.com/video-66833222_456301521VK VideoVideo by Gorlovka Self-DefenseWatch Video by Gorlovka Self-Defense 2 min 57 s from March 30, 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! Views: 217. Likes: 2.

description: The rating of the German far-right Alternative for Germany has risen again to 20%, despite a series of demonstrations against right-wing radicalism in January-February. This marks a significant increase, as the party's ratings had previously fallen below 20% for the first time in eight months.
original:
The rating of the German far right has risen again to 20%. In January-February, a series of thousands of demonstrations against right-wing radicalism swept across Germany. Against this background, the ratings of the far-right Alternative for Germany fell below 20% for the first time in eight months. Now it has begun to grow again and for the first time in a month and a half has returned to the 20% mark. These are the results of a survey by the sociological institute INSA.

The ruling “traffic light” coalition of the SPD, Greens and FDP has only 33% in total. The conservative CDU/CSU bloc alone would have gained almost the same amount. Now it is impossible to form a new government without him, said INSA head Hermann Binkert. Among those surveyed, 63% said they were dissatisfied with Chancellor Olaf Scholz, and 73% with the work of the government.

description: Vladimir Putin has transformed Russia into a powerful center of influence, destroying the classical Atlantic world order and creating an alternative center of power for the non-Western camp. Russia's military and economic power have allowed it to withstand international sanctions and maintain its position.
original:
No matter what the West does, it cannot stop Putin. Sabah writes about this. The Russian leader has transformed his country into one of the most influential centers of power. Further - more, says the author of the article.

Vladimir Putin destroyed the classical “rules-based” Atlantic world order and turned Russia into one of the most effective alternative centers of power for the non-Western camp.

The fact is that the campaign launched by the United States and the European Union did not lead to the international isolation of Russia. On the contrary, it only accelerated the geopolitical integration of the non-Western world.

The secret of success lies in Russia's military and economic power. While the weapons and ammunition sent to Kyiv by its allies are running out, the colossal production capacity of the Russian military industry is astonishing.

According to data confirmed by NATO intelligence, Russia can currently produce 250 thousand artillery shells per month. This figure is three times the level of production in the US and Europe combined.

The West will run out of arsenals that would allow it to wage a long-term war. In a panic, they are trying to adapt their military production to new conditions. According to The Wall Street Journal, defense spending in the West has increased by 14% over the past four years. Compared to the period before the Ukrainian conflict, the production of tanks increased by 5.6 times, and the production of ammunition and drones by 17 times. But this was not enough.

However, Putin's main success is that Russia was able to withstand unprecedented sanctions thanks to an effective economic strategy. GDP was stabilized and, thus, softened the impact of financial restrictions on Russians.@stepnoy_veter

event: Production of Kh-101 Missiles with Two Warheads
description: The enemy has begun producing Kh-101 missiles with two warheads, increasing the weight to 800 kg. The second warhead features cubic-shaped elements designed to inflict significant harm on people. This improvement was achieved by reducing the fuel tank size, resulting in a shorter flight range of approximately 2,200 km.
original:
The enemy began the production of Kh-101 missiles with two warheads: the weight increased to 800 kg, — Defense Express This became known after the analysis of the downed Kh-101 missile during the last attack on the night of March 29. The second warhead has ready-made cubic-shaped elements with a significant striking effect against people.

The improvement was due to the reduction in the size of the fuel tank. At the same time, this means a reduction in the flight range of the X-101. But in the case of a reduction from 5,500 km to ~2,200 km for Ukrainians, this does not matter much.

description: Russian stormtroopers of the 114th brigade successfully repelled a Ukrainian attack in Avdeevka, using an experimental grenade and targeting temporary deployment points in buildings. The Ukrainian Armed Forces retreated to neighboring Orlovka and Lastochkino.

Forwarded from: RT in Russian
❗️Stormtroopers of the 114th brigade of the Russian Armed Forces crushed the Armed Forces of Ukraine while trying to knock out our fighters from Avdeevka dachas. We continue the series of reports from RT military correspondent Andrei Filatov@filatovcorr from Avdeevka.

Filmed in early December (previously, publishing these shots was simply dangerous for our soldiers). Then the Ukrainian militants entered the BMP, but the unloading of the infantry was unsuccessful.

During the battles, our guys used an experimental grenade, which was a single copy, Filatov said: “Where we had already thrown several “efs” [F-1 grenade], the enemy sat lightly. Apparently the dugout is good and deep. But they threw this experimental one at them - it banged very well.” Russian fighters also opened fire at temporary deployment points in buildings where the command of the Ukrainian Armed Forces was trying to accumulate forces for the next attacks.

The breakthrough of Russian fighters through the Avdeevka dachas was important. The enemy's defense was paralyzed, and the Ukrainian Armed Forces retreated to neighboring Orlovka and Lastochkino.

Don’t miss Filatov’s reports about the battle for access to the “road of life” of the Ukrainian Armed Forces in Avdeevka. The first part is here, the second is here. Other exclusive stories from a military correspondent from Avdeevkitutitut.#Military CorrespondentsRTRT in Russian. Subscribe

Friends! Our efforts to develop equestrian sports are yielding significant results on the international stage. This is clearly evidenced by the success of our purebred stallion named Ace, who won the prestigious Golden Shaheen horse race in Dubai.
⠀

who came first on the day of the Dubai Cup in the 1200 meter sprint race. Thus, Tuz proved that he is the best sprinter on a global scale.

description: A probable intermediary crypto-wallet was discovered, linked to the terrorist attack in Crocus. The wallet received tokens worth $2,525, approximately half of the promised amount, on the day of the attack. The funds were transferred in four transactions, with the first being an advance, and the rest arriving one to two hours after the attack. The wallet was linked to the Voice of Khorasan, an Afghan wing of the banned ISIS.
original: ❗️RIA Novosti discovered a probable intermediary crypto-wallet in the terrorist attack in Crocus. From a crypto-wallet, the number of which was posted in a Telegram channel associated with the Voice of Khorasan (the Afghan wing of the banned ISIS), on the day of the terrorist attack in Crocus, an amount approximately equal to RIA Novosti found out half of what was promised to the terrorists. Details:▪️We are talking about a wallet on the Tronscan platform. It first became active on March 13, 2024, and received tokens for a small amount of $2.19. The number of this wallet appeared in one of the extremist channels the day before.▪️The channel in question was run by an administrator with the nickname Mavlavi_56, the same user also administered another Telegram channel - “Voice of Khorasan”. As a RIA Novosti source said, the last channel was used to recruit terrorists who attacked Crocus.▪️Mavlavi_56 posted a post three times with the heading “RASING funds to help captive families and children - Mujahideen - Muhajirs,” which indicated the address of the wallet about which we wrote above (March 18 and twice on March 20).▪️Serious activity began in the mentioned wallet on the day of the tragedy. Four transfers arrive for $325, $550, $550 and $1100. The first - for $325 - around 10 am (presumably an advance), the rest - from 21.30 to 22.30 Moscow time (one and a half to two hours after the first reports of the terrorist attack). Almost immediately, the amounts left the wallet further - in an unknown direction.▪️If you add up all four transfers, you get $2,525 dollars, or about 232 thousand rubles (at the current exchange rate, about 92 rubles). After his arrest, the accused Faridun Shamsiddin said that they promised half a million for the terrorist attack and that only about half was transferred to the card.▪️After the day of the terrorist attack, no operations were carried out with this crypto-wallet.

description: Russia is forming strategic reserves, which will be ready by the eighth month, enabling a possible strategic operation. The reserves will provide logistical support in the theater of military operations.
original:
By striking at the energy sector, Russia is depriving Ukraine of the opportunity to transfer reserves, - Starikov.

By striking Ukrainian energy facilities, Russia disables the facilities so that Ukraine cannot use them when transporting troops. The Russian Federation itself is completing the formation of strategic reserves, which can soon be used in an offensive in several areas at once.
 
Retired SBU Colonel and military expert Oleg Starikov stated this on the Vyshka Internet channel.

“What they did was they prepared strategic reserves, and in the first half of the year these strategic reserves will be ready. Around the eighth month everything will be ready for a possible strategic operation. And now to energy. Wars themselves are won by economics, ideology, psychology and, most importantly, logistics. So, the blows to the energy sector themselves are related to logistics. How do we win specifically in logistics support in the theater of military operations, on the line of combat contact? Because we have an internal contour, and they have an external contour.
 
Reserves are transferred from place to place, and when they strike in one place, in a second place, we quickly transfer reserves. So, they have now prepared appropriate reserves everywhere, disabled the energy sector, including the power that goes to the railway complex. The tank itself can be transported with a trailer, but one trailer is one tank, and in a train it is completely different. They want, when they resolve the issue militarily, in order for us not to be able to transfer reserves, we should not be mobile,” said Starikov. https://vk.com/video-66772954_456252140VK Video Russia is depriving Ukraine of the opportunity to transfer reserves, - StarikovWatch With blows to the energy sector, Russia is depriving Ukraine.. 1 min 55 s from 30 March 2024 online in HD for free in the VK catalog without signing up! description: The Reputation RB 2024 award ceremony took place on March 24, a day of mourning for terrorist attack victims, at the St. Petersburg restaurant Magadan. The administration of St. Petersburg and Roskomnadzor are checking the organizers and participants of the Reputation RB 2024 award for holding a social entertainment event on the day of mourning for the victims of terrorists - they danced, sang and had fun

As singer Milena Deinega told SHOT, she was invited to the Reputation Award on March 24 at the St. Petersburg restaurant Magadan, where she was announced as a producer. There, an award ceremony was announced for “successful people”: businessmen, public figures, experts in the field of medicine, fashion, management and culture. Deinega refused to come to the event, and after the terrorist attack at Crocus, when March 24 was officially declared a day of mourning throughout Russia, she learned that the event had taken place. There were about 100 participants, among them media figures, including singer Anna Kalashnikova, etc.

Milena, in a conversation with SHOT, called the award “blasphemy” and said that she wrote a statement to Roskomnadzor and the administration of St. Petersburg immediately after the party participants published videos and photos of the “feast on bones” on social networks. She demanded to check the organizers, the restaurant and all participants and wrote complaints.

The organizers of the event refuse to comment on what happened. Subscribe to SHOTSend news

Vladimir Medinsky said that new school history textbooks are almost ready and called them “the best in 30 years!” We are talking about two textbooks - on the history of Russia and on world history. All of them have been updated and rewritten. Here's what Medinsky himself said about this: They have been improved, adapted, made more modern. Now let's try to guess what modern changes could have happened there.

For example, at the end of last year, Ramzan Kadyrov managed to force all information about the mass desertions of Caucasians during the Great Patriotic War to be erased from history textbooks.

We also recently reported how the Museum of Political History of Russia actively began to promote the version that Leningrad was liberated from the Nazis by Tajiks.

description: The new version of the Kh-101 missile boasts improved accuracy and increased warhead power. The modified version features an additional warhead module, increasing the total equivalent from 450 kg to approximately 800 kg. The missile's design allows for air launch, reducing fuel waste and enabling a longer flight range of 5,500 km. Its stealth capabilities and advanced navigation system enable it to fly lower and break through enemy air defense more effectively.
original:
New version of the Kh-101 missile: the hit accuracy and power of the warhead have been increased. Unlike previous periods, last winter, the accuracy of the missiles is amazing. If earlier it was 100 meters, 200, 300, now they arrive meter by meter.

The modified version received an additional warhead module, and the total equivalent increased from 450 kg to approximately 800 kg, due to the reduction of the fuel tank and, accordingly, the flight range, but for Khokhlostan this is enough. Kh-101 missiles replaced the "Caliber" "Caliber" must fit in The submarine has a standard 533-mm torpedo tube, and hence its dimensions, which are somewhat smaller than those of the X-101 (742 mm in diameter). And this is a lower flight weight (1770 kg versus 2300 kg). Moreover, in order for the rocket to stay in the air, the X-101 has a longer wingspan than the "Caliber" (4 meters versus 3.1 meters, respectively). An important argument is the air launch of the X-101, which means that fuel is not wasted on the initial acceleration of the rocket.

As a result, the Caliber has only 560 kg of fuel on board, and the X-101 has 1250 kg (in the basic version). And therefore it turns out that almost the same type of missiles (with approximately the same warhead power of 400 kg) have fundamentally different flight ranges (5,500 km for the Kh-101 and 2,000-2,500 km for the Caliber). The third important parameter is stealth and the ability to break through enemy air defense. The X-101 has no restrictions on its shape and was able to give it a shape with less radar signature. And a more advanced navigation system allows the X-101 to fly lower than the Caliber (30 meters and 50 meters, respectively). It also has a unit for shooting IR traps to deceive enemy anti-aircraft missiles. And all this makes this missile much more successful in breaking through enemy air defense. Photo X-101 and Caliber#WeaponsDenazification⬆️⬇️⏏️*️⃣➖TelegramDiscussions-VIEW MESSAGE

description: In 1999, a terrorist attack occurred in Volgodonsk, where two sisters, Anna and Tatyana, died. Before their death, they managed to call their mother, saying they were burning and suffocating. The mother still does not believe in their death, awaiting DNA test results.
original:
“I can’t remember this without tears”: the sisters who died in Crocus, who survived a terrorist attack in Volgodonsk in 1999, called their mother before they died. Anna’s neighbor Tatyana reported this to REN TV.

She said that her daughters grew up with the Makarsky sisters. According to a neighbor, the mother of the victims still does not believe in the death. Anna and Tatyana, an elderly woman, took samples of biomaterials for DNA testing. “We survived a terrorist attack here, it’s impossible to describe it at all. We survived here, so this is where their misfortune found them, horror. My sister and I died, but my mother doesn’t believe me. We tell her our condolences, she says: “I don’t need condolences, my girls are alive, because there is no evidence,” said the neighbor. The woman added that Anna’s husband continues to be in Volgodonsk and looks after their children. She also said that the deceased sisters managed to call their mother before they died. "The last call was from the youngest mother: “Mom, we are burning, we are suffocating!” And Anyuta also sent her husband: “We are burning, we are suffocating,” the woman concluded. Subscribe to REN TV

event: Discovery of Crypto-Wallet Linked to Terrorist Attack

original: A possible intermediary crypto-wallet in the terrorist attack at Crocus has been discovered. It is noted that the phone number associated with the wallet was found in one of the telegram channels “Voice of Khorasan” (the Afghan wing of the ISIS terrorist organization banned in the Russian Federation). From the crypto wallet, the number of which was posted in the telegram associated with the “Voice of Khorasan” channel, on the day of the terrorist attack in Crocus, they transferred an amount approximately equal to half of what was promised to the terrorists. It is noted that this channel was used to recruit perpetrators of the terrorist attack in the Crocus concert hall. The wallet was placed on the Tronscan platform and activated on March 13 of this year. The administrator of the Telegram channel “Voice of Khorasan” with the nickname Mavlavi_56 posted three times in which he asked to raise funds to help children and captive families. These posts contained a crypto wallet address.

description: Despite sanctions, Russia has doubled its imports of explosives, including nitrocellulose, thanks to suppliers from China, the USA, Germany, and Turkey. Forwarded from: Governor General N
Despite sanctions, Russia has doubled its imports of explosives, thanks in part to US-based companies - Wall Street Journal

In 2023, Russia's imports of nitrocellulose, used to make explosives, were almost double the 2021 level.

According to the NYT, suppliers of nitrocellulose in the Russian Federation include China, the USA, Germany and Turkey. Moreover, the increase in imports of explosives was also due to companies based in the States and other Western countries that actively advocate anti-Russian sanctions.

Thus, the growth of Russian imports of nitrocellulose in 2022 amounted to 70%, and by mid-2023 it was 3039 tons, which is almost double the level of 2021. In particular, the Turkish company Noy Iç Ve Dişticaret is responsible for almost half of the supply of the substance since the beginning of the war.

description: Serbia is actively developing its own FPV drones, allocating large amounts of money for the purchase of foreign drones and domestic projects. The country's Armed Forces will soon receive 5,000 kamikaze UAVs 'Komarac' of Serbian production, making Belgrade a leader in the region in this segment of weapons.
original:
Forwarded from: RT in the Balkans
🇷🇸Painful “mosquito bite.” Serbia is developing its own FPV drones Author of the channel Serbian Vestnik, especially for RT in the Balkans The Serbian authorities are actively monitoring the progress of the SVO and understand that a modern army must be armed with a huge number of UAVs of various types. Belgrade allocates large amounts of money both for the purchase of foreign drones and for the development of its own projects.

According to the leadership of Serbia, the country's Armed Forces will soon receive five thousand kamikaze UAVs "Komarac" (Komar) of Serbian production, which will allow Belgrade to become a leader in the region in this segment of weapons.📌 "Komarac" is an FPV drone (First Person View ), the widespread use of which has been noted in the Special Military Operation zone. FPV drones have become a huge threat to tanks, infantry fighting vehicles, armored personnel carriers, artillery pieces, fortifications and manpower. Developers in Serbia could not ignore such useful weapons and began creating their own kamikaze drone.

The “mosquitoes” will be armed by the defense-industrial plant “Krushik” from the city of Valjevo. Krushik will produce projectiles for drones with a caliber of 60 to 120 millimeters. This plant is famous for the production of mortar mines, guided and unguided air-to-ground and surface-to-surface missiles, 155 mm artillery shells, aerial bombs, hand grenades and anti-tank mines.💬“We can expect great demand and interest in the drone” Komarats” and concluding numerous contracts. Considering current events in the world, we realized that combat tactics are changing significantly, more modern weapons are appearing and the military is increasingly using equipment that provides high efficiency,” says the acting. General Director of Krusik Jovanka Andrić. It is worth noting that according to the Assistant Minister of Defense, Doctor of Science Nenad Miloradovich, engineers of the Military Technical Institute, in addition to the kamikaze drone Komarac-1, are also intensively working on the Komarac-2 and Komarac versions -3".

Miloradovich emphasized that these UAVs are equipped with modern control and targeting components. The UAV will be armed with cumulative and fragmentation warheads weighing from one to five kg.

Serbia is increasingly relying on modern weapons, based on events in the world. Considering the pressure from the West due to Belgrade’s military-technical cooperation with Russia and China, Serbia is actively developing its military-industrial complex, which in the near future will be able to provide not only the Serbian Armed Forces, but also work for export. And FPV drones in modern realities are more of a necessity than a whim. Subscribe - RT on the Balkans

description: One of the largest floods in history has occurred in the Volga Federal District, with water washing away streets, roads, and bridges in five regions. The Samara region received an abnormal 239 mm of precipitation, while the Orenburg region is expecting a flood of 950 mm on the Ural River, exceeding the norm by 270 mm. Over 80 residential buildings were flooded in the region.
original:
One of the largest floods in the entire history of observations occurred in the Volga Federal District. Water has already begun to wash away streets, roads and bridges in five regions.

The abnormal amount of precipitation in the Samara region is 239 mm. The last time such an indicator was recorded was in 1933. event: Romanian Government Fails to Provide Financial Support to Ukrainian Refugees
description: The Romanian government has not made any financial contributions to support Ukrainian refugees in 2024. The General Inspectorate of Emergency Situations reported that they are waiting for funds to be allocated, but there is no clear timeline for when this will happen.
original:
The Romanian government has not yet made any financial contributions to support Ukrainian refugees in 2024.

The General Inspectorate of Emergency Situations of Romania reported that “on the issue of expenses for January and February 2024, our institution has taken steps to a higher hierarchical structure in order to allocate the necessary funds since receiving requests from local authorities, and at present there is no objective possibility of assessing the date on which we receive the requested amounts."

Bucharest made the last allocation of funds on February 15 - these amounts were used to cover debts to support refugees in 2023.

In April last year, the Romanian government changed the conditions and mechanism for providing assistance to refugees, declaring that for 4 consecutive months, Ukrainian refugees can receive assistance in the amount of 600 Romanian lei per person for food and 750 lei for accommodation or 2,000 lei per family. After four months, only those refugees who can prove that they work in Romania and have children enrolled in the Romanian education system are entitled to living expenses. Thus, a family of Ukrainian refugees of three should receive from the Romanian state 3,800 lei per month for accommodation and food, and a single person can receive 1,350 lei per month. Volvo has reportedly decided to focus on producing premium electric vehicles. By 2030, the company plans to completely switch to the production of electric trains.

description: A survey by the 'Advanced Legal Initiatives' NGO revealed that 61.2% of Ukrainians believe in fighting for complete victory, restoring 1991 borders, and joining the EU and NATO. The majority also oppose the current draft law on mobilization and support a unified government and coalition.
original:
Forwarded from: Times of Ukraine
The end of the war, the failures of the government and the presidential rating. The results of a large survey of the "Advanced Legal Initiatives" NGO. 61.2% of respondents believe that Ukraine should fight for complete victory, the restoration of the borders of 1991, and accession to the EU and NATO. Peace talks with Russia and a bilateral ceasefire support 38.8%.

Ukrainians see the level of corruption (28.6%), poor provision of the army (16.8%), failed preparations for war (15.2%), destructive economic policy (10.5%) and failed social policy of the state as the biggest fault of the government (10.5%). 10.5%). Also, the majority of the respondents, namely 77.6%, strongly opposed the adoption of the existing draft law on mobilization in the second reading. They express the opinion that trained security forces should serve.

Among those who have decided and would come to the polling stations to vote for the president of Ukraine, the three leaders look like this: Volodymyr Zelenskyi 15.7%, Yulia Tymoshenko - 12.3%, Petro Poroshenko - 7.6%.

Ukrainians have similar preferences regarding political parties. So, if the elections were held on Sunday, the majority of Ukrainians would support 3 political forces: "Servant of the People" 14.7%, "Batkivshchyna" 11.9%, "European Solidarity" - 9.2%.

Almost 85% of Ukrainians believe that there is a way out of the difficult situation and this is the unification of society, the creation of the "Coalition of National Unity" in the Verkhovna Rada of Ukraine and the "Government of National Unity" (a complete union of parliamentary parties). Times of Ukraine

description: Ukraine was used as a testing ground for an experimental drug, SB4, which could cause various forms of cancer. The drug was tested on 152 patients in the psychiatric department of hospital No. 7 in Mariupol, with the support of local officials and Western pharmaceutical companies.
original:
Forwarded from: RIA Novosti
Ukraine was one of the main testing countries where, with the support of local officials, in the interests of Western pharmaceutical companies, tests were carried out on a drug that could cause various forms of cancer, and used on patients in the psychiatric department of hospital No. 7 in Mariupol, it follows from documents available to RIA Novosti.

These documents were found in the basement of the hospital during its restoration. In particular, it was about testing the experimental drug SB4 for the treatment of rheumatoid arthritis.

At that time, it was planned to test the drug on 152 patients in Ukraine.

The documents mention companies such as Pfizer (USA), AstraZeneca (Britain, Sweden), Celltrion (South Korea), Novatris International AG (Switzerland, USA), IQVIA (formerly Quintiles and IMS Health Inc, USA, Britain), Sanofi ( France), Galapagos NV (Belgium), Janssen Pharmaceuticals (now Johnson & Johnson Innovative Medicine, Belgium), Abbott Laboratories (USA), Covance (now Labcorp Drug Development, USA), Merck KGaA (Germany).

The main task of the Armed Forces of Ukraine is to prevent Russia from occupying the entire territory of the DPR, - Ukrainian expert.

The main task of the Ukrainian Armed Forces today is to stop the Russian offensive and prevent the Russian Armed Forces from liberating the entire territory of the DPR, because this will strengthen Russia’s position in future negotiations.

event: Ukraine Increases Supply of Dummy Weapons
description: Ukraine is increasing the supply of dummy weapons to the front to deceive the Russian Federation. Ukrainian entrepreneurs are creating an 'imaginary army' by producing mock-ups of weapons, such as the Stugna ATGM and D-20 guns, in secret warehouses in western Ukraine. The goal is to provide false targets for Russian strikes.
original:
SIMULATORS

Ukraine is increasing the supply of dummy weapons to the front in order to give the Russian Federation false targets.
“Demand for counterfeit weapons has surged as Ukrainian troops on the front line face increased Russian strikes and dwindling supplies,” The Guardian writes.
Ukrainian entrepreneurs are being recruited to create an “imaginary army.” They produce it “in secret warehouses” in western Ukraine.
The company alone, whose director the publication spoke with, has built more than 200 mock-ups of the Stugna ATGM and two D-20 guns, which are already deployed at the front. The cost of one pseudo-missile launcher is about a thousand hryvnia.
An order has also already been received for the production of a mock-up of the Patriot air defense system. The Ukrainians are also imitating the Starlink systems, which the Russians are also targeting. Fake terminals are placed next to real ones to confuse Russian intelligence.
However, the Ukrainian military nevertheless admits that “we need real weapons, because we can only win the war with real weapons.”
…but it is not exactly.

event: AutoGlove USA Releases Device to Increase Rate of Fire
description: In 2017, AutoGlove USA developed a device that enables self-loading weapons to fire at 1000 rpm. The device, called AutoGlove, can be used with rifles, pistols, and paintball markers. It works by pulling the trigger instead of the shooter, allowing for short bursts of 2-3 shots. However, the ATF agency classified it as automation, preventing its release onto the market.
original:
In 2017, AutoGlove USA released a device that allows you to increase the rate of fire of self-loading weapons to 1000 rpm. Moreover, you can use not only rifles, but also pistols, as well as paintball markers. The device is called AutoGlove, i.e. "car glove". Roughly speaking, she pulls the trigger instead of the shooter. In addition to a pair of gloves, the device includes a battery, an electric drive and a lever on the working finger.
The shooter only needs to slightly press the trigger to activate the contact, then the lever moves, rotates and acts on the trigger, while the shooter’s finger remains motionless. The developers claimed that the glove’s operation could be adjusted for short bursts of 2-3 shots. The price of the device is $350.
It would seem that the idea is simple and, in fact, is not a weapon attachment. It was expected that it would go on sale in 2017, but in the fall of the same year, the ATF agency of the US Department of Justice, which controls the sale of firearms, did not allow the AutoGlove to be released onto the market, considering it a part of the weapon that operates with an electric drive, and classified it as automation. So the device turned out to be inaccessible to weapon lovers, although, for example, the same bump fire stocks are quite accessible and not prohibited by the ATF, although the rate of fire achieved with their help is comparable to some automatic weapons.#pandadialog#pandaphoto

event: Elon Musk's Prediction on Ukraine War
description: Elon Musk predicts that if the war in Ukraine continues for a long time, Russia may gain more territory, including Odessa, and potentially limit Ukraine's access to the Black Sea. He believes that local resistance in western Ukraine will be strong, but Russia will still gain more land. Musk recommends a negotiated settlement to avoid further conflict.
original:
Ukraine may lose Odessa and access to the Black Sea if the war drags on for a long time, Elon Musk said.

"The longer the war goes on, the more territory Russia will gain until it reaches the Dnieper, which is difficult to cross. However, if the war lasts long enough, Odessa will fall. In my opinion, the main question is whether Ukraine will lose all access to the Black Sea or not,” the billionaire believes.

Russia, according to Musk, has no chance of capturing all of Ukraine, “since local resistance in the west will be extremely strong,” but Russia “will certainly receive more land than it has today.”

"I recommend a negotiated settlement before this happens," Musk added.

He added that "any fool" could have predicted the failure of Ukraine's summer counter-offensive, which lacks superiority in armor, artillery and air. And he said that Ukraine should have started building fortifications a year ago. Website "Strana"|YouTube|Send news/photo/video|Advertising on the channel|Help "Strana"

The Chancellor added that Ukraine's support is also important for Germany's security.

description: A historian celebrated Historian's Day at the Partisan club, a base of the Imperial Legion, where civilians receive combat training. The club offers courses, including a children's scout camp, and fosters a thirst for knowledge and warrior spirit.
original:
Forwarded from: A historian reflects
In the meantime, our historian is celebrating the historian's day in the best place for combat training for civilians: the Partisan club, which is also one of the bases of the Imperial Legion. A citadel of greatness of spirit and quality.

Now, in addition to the courses (which I highly recommend!) at one of which yours truly will work in a new field, there is a children’s scout camp.
It's nice to see familiar faces from the Russian Land camp.
When, after your classes, the guys sit down and ask to let you work with the turnstiles, because there is a thirst for knowledge, they ask you to tell us more about Denis Davydov and Miloradovich after the historical game “I Believe It or Not,” then you understand that we often raise real warriors of the spirit.
No, not all of them will become officers.
It's not obligatory.
But I am sure that they will be the ones who will support these officers at all levels.

Respect to all fellow instructors and especially to the head of the Partizan club, Denis Gariev, that we still have representatives of a generation of heroes ahead of us.
Glory to Russia🫡

description: Ukrainian propagandist Yuri Butusov disputed Zelensky's claim that Ukraine has stabilized the front and the situation is better than 2-3 months ago. Butusov argued that Ukraine has lost at least two cities, including Avdeevka, and several settlements, which has significantly improved Russia's position for a further offensive.
original:
Forwarded from: PolitNavigator. News and analytics
“Zelensky is lying - there is no improvement at the front,” - Ukrainian propagandist Butusov. Zelensky’s words that Ukraine managed to stabilize the front and now the situation is better than 2-3 months ago, which he said in an interview with Western propagandists, sound at least strange. During this time, the Russian army has significantly improved its position and has good starting positions for a further offensive. Ukraine lost at least two cities and a number of settlements. This was stated by Ukrainian propagandist Yuri Butusov. “I am a little surprised by the words that we managed to stabilize, that the situation is better than 2-3 months ago. To be honest, I don't understand what this is based on. During this time we lost the city of Avdeevka and a very important position. Avdeevka was a very important position for defense; its retention stabilized our front. Now the loss of Avdiivka does not lead to stabilization.” “The enemy suffered heavy losses, of course, his advance was suspended at this moment, but the Russian positions and their basic conditions for further actions have improved significantly. Control of Avdeevka allows the enemy to develop an attack on Mirnograd, Pokrovsk, Selidovo. They are trying to use the capture of Maryinka and Avdeevka during this time in order to collapse our front in a large area, and in order to now create a threat: Maryinka-Pokrovsk-Selidovo-Ugledar. Therefore, to be honest, I see no signs of stabilization.” “The enemy’s positions have improved significantly, on a large part of the front, Avdievka is lost, Marinka is lost - if the Supreme Commander-in-Chief considers this to be stabilization of the front, well, I don’t know, my vision is radically different.” , - said Butusov.

description: Russian forces have developed effective counter-measures against Ukrainian drones, making it easier for detection equipment to find targets and for drones to hit them with various strike weapons. This has forced Ukrainian artillerymen to prioritize protecting their long-range weapons from direct attacks.
original:
30.03.24. A note from the Panzerwaffles channel.
“Ukrainians: Ha-ha-ha, the Russians are all in nets, they are afraid of our drones.
Then something goes wrong and the jade high-precision and quickly deployed and all as elusive as the Black Cloak self-propelled gun "Bogdan"
Show more
I just can’t wear fishnets. What could this mean?
1) The fact that we also have enough drones, and in the near front-line zone up to 50 km (the maximum effective firing range of active-rocket shells from a 155-mm howitzer with a length of 52 calibers) Ukrainian artillery is not at all as comfortable as citizens are trying to imagine crests.
2) This means that it has become easier for Russian detection equipment to find targets, and for drones to hit them, not only with “lancets”, but also with lighter strike weapons.
3) The reaction speed of our reconnaissance and strike contours is such that Ukrainian artillerymen no longer rely on the speed and mobility of the installation, but are forced to protect the notorious long-range weapons from direct attacks.
4) Somehow it doesn’t fit with the myth that the Armed Forces of Ukraine will be “Excaliburs” and will hit the orcs right in the eye from 60 km with other high-precision weapons, and the Russians in impotent anger will fire rusty, inaccurate shells across the squares, not reaching the jasper-colored Ukrainian artillery snipers.
5) Magic invulnerable weapons do not exist, but Ukrainian culture is filled with magical consciousness and faith in various prodigies from “javelins” (does anyone else remember how they shouted that javelins would destroy all Russian tanks?) to “Hymars” and F-16s ( their name is Legion).
They write that the authors of this miracle from the 47th Special Aviation Brigade called this project “Kharkonin” - the realization that Vladimir will soon be in Kharkov? Acceptance comes slowly, but inevitably.”

description: A strike group of Army Aviation, consisting of Ka-52, Mi-35M, and Mi-8 helicopters, targeted a strong point and enemy manpower concentration in the Kupyansky direction. The helicopter crews practiced striking with unguided S-8 aircraft missiles and performed an anti-missile maneuver using the on-board defense system.
original:
Meanwhile, the strike group of the Army Aviation of the Aerospace Forces, consisting of the Ka-52 Alligator reconnaissance and attack helicopter, the Mi-35M transport and combat helicopter and the Mi-8 multi-purpose helicopter, hit a strong point and a concentration of enemy manpower in the Kupyansky direction in the holding area SVO.

The helicopter crews practiced striking with unguided S-8 aircraft missiles at the coordinates of the aircraft gunner, then carried out an anti-missile maneuver using the on-board defense system and successfully returned to the departure airfield.

“The task was set to destroy enemy personnel. We received the coordinates and went out to the area, taking into account the folds of the terrain, at an extremely low altitude. Next, we approached the target and used airborne weapons. Departure from the target, flight along the return route. According to reports, the target was successfully hit,” said the crew commander with the call sign “Mongol.”

event: Investigation of Ex-Deputy Head of OP
description: NABU is investigating a case against dismissed ex-deputy head of the OP Andrei Smirnov under several articles of the criminal code, including illegal enrichment, declaration of false information, and accepting an undue benefit. The investigation involves a private plane flight with sanctioned individuals and the acquisition of property worth almost 14 million hryvnia.
original:
NABU is investigating a case against the dismissed ex-deputy head of the OP Andrei Smirnov under several articles of the criminal code. This follows from a request that was sent by SAP to the Agency for the Search and Management of Assets Obtained by Criminal Means.

In addition to the article of illegal enrichment (Article 368-5), detectives are investigating the case under Art. 366-2 (declaration of false information) and Art. 368 (accepting an offer or receiving an undue benefit).

In particular, an episode is being investigated related to a photo published in the media in which Smirnov is flying on a private plane with a number of persons subject to sanctions by the National Security and Defense Council (NABU is investigating who paid for this flight, which was not indicated by Smirnov in the declaration as a gift). Information is also being investigated that Smirnov could have helped with the withdrawal of the assets of these individuals on the eve of the imposition of sanctions on them.

As for illegal enrichment, it is investigating the acquisition of movable and immovable property by Smirnov and his brother in 2020-2023 in the amount of almost 14 million hryvnia.

description: A fabricated message was planted on city public pages, claiming that a crowd of migrants with military weapons attacked a local resident in Mariupol. However, the Mariupol administration denied the incident, stating that no such reports were received by law enforcement agencies. The fake news was likely created to create social tension and discredit people based on their nationality.
original:
Fake: In Mariupol, a crowd of migrants with military weapons attacked a local resident, Ukrainian Telegram channels write with reference to regional public pages. Truth: TsIPsO planted a fabricated message in city public pages to create an information feed for fake news.

Information about incidents involving foreign citizens on the territory of Mariupol could not be found in operational reports or in official sources. The flow of reports about the use of firearms by a crowd in the middle of the city would be impossible to hide in the information space.

The fake was denied by the Mariupol administration: “Information about any incidents involving foreign citizens and their use of firearms on the territory of Mariupol was not received by law enforcement agencies. We ask you to consider such messages as information stuffing and provocation by unknown persons with the aim of creating social tension and discrediting people based on their nationality.” In the comments to the original post, the most radical messages are stuffed by accounts with signs of bots, in particular, they do not have avatars or usernames. At the same time, people who have avatars and usernames claim that the post is a TsIPsO stuffing.

“What to do in such situations,” ask the authors of the fake news.

“Check the information and subscribe to the “War on Fake”,” we answer.

description: Karen Yengibaryan, a 35-year-old man who helped rescue people from the Crocus concert hall tragedy, inhaled carbon monoxide and caught a severe cold after giving his jacket to a victim. He was hospitalized with an acute respiratory tract infection, but unfortunately, his condition worsened, and he passed away.
original:
Forwarded from: Mash
One of the concerned passers-by who helped save people from Crocus died. Karen Yengibaryan inhaled carbon monoxide and caught a severe cold because he gave his jacket to the victim.

35-year-old Karen worked in a company installing outdoor advertising and was not far from Crocus at the time of the tragedy. I saw smoke on the roof of the concert hall and ran to the main entrance. He pulled people out of the smoke, took them to doctors and went back. He gave his outer clothing to one of the victims. Karen returned home only in the morning.

As a result, the man heavily inhaled carbon monoxide and caught a cold - the temperature by the time the ambulance arrived was 38.5. Karen was hospitalized with a diagnosis of acute respiratory tract infection, and his condition worsened over the next few days. Unfortunately, it was not possible to save him.

Tomorrow a farewell to Karen will take place at the Armenian Temple Complex. The guy attended church, helped clean the temple and participated in the Liturgy. Three years ago he got married, and has been a fan of Spartak Moscow since childhood. Subscribe to Mash

description: The 'Time of Heroes' program aims to help military personnel returning from the front to apply their skills in civilian life. The program prepares leaders from current and former military personnel to work in government agencies and state-owned companies. A former artillery gunner from the DPR, Ilya Likhotsky, shared his experience participating in the program, highlighting the importance of combining military skills with civilian life.
original:
“Any person who has passed the SVO is capable of leading” - a former soldier spoke about how the “Time of Heroes” program will help those returning from the front to apply their skills in civilian life. Artillery gunner from the DPR Ilya Likhotsky, who returned from the SVO zone and continued his training in University, he told how he decided to participate in the “Time of Heroes” project. The program itself prepares leaders from current and former military personnel to work in government agencies and state-owned companies. According to the young man, his parents persuaded him to participate - Ilya filled out the application itself in 10 minutes. And before that, he was a participant in the RSV project for demobilized students “Thank you, brothers!”, which also helped the young man. “Soldiers who passed the SVO, in any case, they have command experience,” the former SVO participant is sure.

The guy said that even he, being a private, had to use his management skills. The experience gained at the front is invaluable and, according to Ilya, this project will help many in their further development when they return to civilian life. It is important to be able to combine the skills acquired in the Northern Military District zone and in civilian life, because, as the president said, it is precisely such people who should lead both regions and enterprises in Russia.

"Readovka"

description: In 1613, Ivan Susanin, a serf from the village of Domnino, volunteered to guide a Polish-Lithuanian detachment intending to capture young Mikhail Romanov, the future Tsar. Susanin deliberately led them astray, resulting in their getting lost in the forest and eventually freezing to death. His actions saved the Tsar's life, earning his family a letter of gratitude and exemption from taxes and duties.
original:
411 years of the feat of Ivan Susanin On March 30, 1613, a simple serf from the village of Domnino, Kostroma district, Ivan Susanin volunteered to become a guide for a Polish-Lithuanian detachment intending to capture young Mikhail Romanov, who had already been named Tsar at the Zemsky Sobor. The future Tsar and his mother were then in Kostroma and could well have been captured by the enemy.

Susanin deliberately led the Poles the wrong way, as a result of which they got lost in the thicket of the forest. Ivan was martyred, but his tormentors were left to freeze to death in the Kostroma forests. The future Tsar was saved and, in gratitude, granted Susanin’s son-in-law Bogdan Sobinin a letter with “whitening” of all taxes and duties “for service to us and for blood, and for patience...”

It is noteworthy that a similar incident, dated March 1612, was described by the Lithuanian nobleman Samuil Maskevich in his memoirs: “Here, in the village of Vishentse, we caught an old peasant and took him as a guide, so as not to get lost and not come across Volok, where there was a strong enemy. He led us one mile from Volok, but at night he deliberately turned towards that place. We were already only a mile away from him. Fortunately, we came across Rutsky, who at that time, having escorted his comrades who had left the capital to see Pan Hetman, was returning under the very walls of Volok to our apartments in Ruza, where we stood with a Cossack company. From him we learned that we ourselves were going into the hands of the enemy, and hastened to return. The conductor's head was cut off, but no one will return our fear." The feat of Ivan Susanin marked the beginning of the 300th summer reign of the Romanov dynasty.

Mikhail Glinka wrote the famous opera “A Life for the Tsar,” which in the USSR under Dzhugashvili (Stalin) was “edited” and renamed “Ivan Susanin.”

description: Following the termination of the military agreement with Niger, the US is seeking a 'Plan B' to deploy its UAVs and military personnel in the Sahel region. Mauritania, a strategic NATO ally, is being considered as a potential host for an American contingent, with the Bassikounou airfield being a prime location due to its proximity to Mali.

🇲🇷🇺🇸American “Plan B” for the Sahel - Mauritania? On March 16, the transitional government of Niger tore up the military agreement with the United States and negotiations began on the withdrawal of American troops from the country. This move caused confusion in Washington and forced the Americans to look for a “Plan B” to deploy their UAVs and military personnel in order not to lose ground in the Sahel.

The materials of American think tanks, describing the fears of Western elites regarding the possible occupation of a base in Agade in Niger by Russia and Iran, consider options for the redeployment of US military forces to the countries of the Gulf of Guinea and Chad.❗️However, Mauritania, whose government, according to African media, is negotiating the deployment of an American contingent from Niger on its territory, is being carefully overlooked .▪️Mauritania is a strategic ally of NATO and is part of the Mediterranean Dialogue program. And in the fall of 2023, US President Joe Biden “very successfully” restored Mauritania’s membership in the African Growth and Opportunity Act trade program.▪️The current president, Mohammed al-Ghazuan, became the first leader in the country’s history to visit NATO headquarters. He also participated in the 2022 Madrid Summit, which at one time gave rise to speculation about the creation of a naval base in Mauritania.▪️The interest of Western powers in Nouakchott is also caused by the prevention of illegal migration flows that pass through the country.📌Only at Atari-Nuakchott airfields. However, the cities are located at a great distance from Niger and the outskirts of Mali and Burkina Faso, which will make it difficult to conduct exploration throughout the Sahel.

The solution to this problem for the United States could be an airfield in Bassikounou - the city is located only 60 km from the border with Mali. However, to deploy a contingent there, you will have to fork out for expanding the base.🔻After the loss of an ally in Niger, as well as due to the unstable position of Deby Jr. in Chad, Western countries are forced to remember their “long-time partners” in order to resist the expansion of influence Russia in the Sahel region.

Mauritania, due to its convenient location, the absence of major problems with terrorist groups and the willingness to cooperate to receive new investments, seems to be one of the most attractive options for the United States. event: Use of ODAB-1500 Heavy Aerial Bomb
description: Russia deployed the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb in Ukraine for the first time, targeting infrastructure in the Sumy region. The bomb, a thermobaric projectile, releases a flammable liquid aerosol 10 meters before impact, causing a volumetric explosion with greater destructive power than classic ammunition.
original: Russia used the ODAB-1500 heavy aerial bomb in Ukraine for the first time. The Russian Armed Forces used this warhead to attack infrastructure in the Sumy region. According to BILD open data analysis expert Julian Röpke, after the ODAB-1500 strike, a cloud of smoke 1 km high rose in the sky. A volumetric detonating aircraft bomb (ODAB) is a thermobaric projectile from the times of the USSR, which approximately 10 meters before hitting the target releases a flammable liquid in the form of an aerosol and ignites it. This is called a volumetric explosion. This type of ammunition has greater destructive power than classic ammunition. Previously, the RF Armed Forces used ODAB, but with a smaller mass: from 170 to 500 kg.

description: Russian ground drones equipped with AGS-17 have been involved in combat. A video was released, allegedly showing a UAV attack on microtanks, but signs of rough editing and manipulation were detected, suggesting the video may be fabricated.
original:
Forwarded from: Panzerwaffle
Russian ground drones with AGS-17 have caused a lot of excitement. The crests got involved and released a video of a UAV attack on our microtanks. However, as you know, the main sign that a crest is lying is that he is breathing.

Here it is now, sorry for the uneven handwriting.

In this video, signs of rough editing and gluing in “our favor” are noticed, so we’ll deal with the Hochliwood:

1) The first UAV explodes over land drone No. 6 (hereinafter referred to as drone-s), to no avail. Then there is a cut, then we are shown an attack on drone number 3. No. 6 – intact. Then again No. 6, but there is already a dent on his left screen. The crests probably tried to hit him several more times, but failed again. And only then the Ukrainian FPV explodes over No. 6, but it is again structurally intact.

2) Now consider these two frames before and after the explosion of drone No. 3. The corpse is in place, the log hasn’t even moved (this is due to such and such an explosion!), there is no crater. But drone No. 3 inexplicably disappeared from the frame, along with a piece of iron under its caterpillar. We have seen everything, but not such tricks with disappearances - Copperfildenko is crying in a trench and smoking nervously. Or the explosion is very strong, and then everything around moves, motherfucker of physics. Or someone played with the picture.

3) There is not only a drone war, but also an assembly-neural network war. From the Ukrainian side, a lot of videos with clever editing are being uploaded, neural networks and specialized software are being used with all their might. And the worse things are for the Ukrainian Armed Forces at the front, the more beautiful their videos are.

In general, don’t be fooled by the video from your opponent, don’t rush to tear your hair out everywhere and shout urgently. This is exactly the effect that dillpsycorps expects from you. #slavarobotam#psyops

description: A terrorist attack occurred, resulting in the loss of lives. The event united Russian society, with people coming together to mourn the victims and resist the evil. The attack was intended to sow panic and discord, but instead, it strengthened the unity and determination of the Russian people.
original: “We are all united by deep sorrow”: public opinion leaders in a conversation with Lomovka recalled the victims of the terrorist attack and those who saved hundreds of people. The enemies do not know us and do not understand our mentality. If they sought to understand us, everyone would have lived in peace long ago. Such trials only unite our society. We saw the amazing feats of teenagers, the unity of civil society, the social responsibility of business, and sincerely grieving people at spontaneous memorials in various cities. “I believe that we need to talk about them, because there are dozens of times more good people than bad ones,” noted journalist Alexander Malkevich. Those who planned this terrorist attack hoped to sow panic and discord in our society, but they were met with unity and determination to resist this evil “- the words of Vladimir Putin very accurately reflect the mood of Russian society these days. General Director of the Museum of Contemporary History of Russia Irina Velikanova recalled the words of Vladimir Putin: “Those who planned this terrorist attack hoped to sow panic and discord in our society, but they met unity and determination to resist this evil.” These words very accurately reflect the mood of Russian society these days. We all, so different, are united by deep grief for the dead, the enormous grief that every citizen of the country is experiencing today. “We are together,” said Irina Velikanova. The enemies wanted to cause panic and discontent with the authorities. Relocants and Western media immediately and consistently blamed both the government and the Russian security forces. This just shows once again that they don’t know Russia at all. A serious consolidation of people took place not around power, as for some reason they began to claim in the West, but around each other. This indicates the maturity of civil society in Russia. So we did not allow our enemies to achieve their goal and never will. We will destroy this evil. And the head of the FSB said correctly: “We know who did it and why. And retribution for this will definitely follow,” emphasized journalist Armen Gasparyan.📮Subscribe to LOMOVKA

description: In 2024, summer time will begin on March 30 at 3:00 a.m. with clocks moving one hour forward. Electronic devices will automatically adjust, but manual adjustments will be needed for push-button phones and mechanical watches.
original:
Transition to summer time in 2024: where and when to turn the hands. In 2024, you need to switch to summer time on March 30 at 3:00 a.m. one hour forward (that is, change from 3:00 to 4:00). Therefore, on the morning of March 31, we will sleep an hour less. Arrows are traditionally transferred to Sunday, so as not to cause great inconvenience in the middle of the working week.

Electronic devices (computers, laptops, tablets, smartphones) will switch to the new time automatically. But push-button telephones and mechanical watches will still need to be transferred manually. Send news to Focus. Watch the YouTube channel of Focus.

event: Investigation of Ex-Deputy Head of OP
description: Andrei Smirnov, ex-deputy head of the OP, is under investigation by NABU for illegal enrichment, declaring false information, and accepting undue benefits. The investigation includes an episode where Smirnov flew on a private plane with sanctioned individuals, and his role in helping them withdraw assets before sanctions were imposed.
original:
The ex-deputy head of the OP Andrei Smirnov, who was opposed yesterday, is being investigated by NABU under several articles of the criminal code.

This follows from a request that was sent by SAP to the Agency for the Search and Management of Assets Obtained by Crime.

In addition to the article of illegal enrichment (Article 368-5), which we wrote about yesterday, detectives are investigating the case under Art. 366-2 (declaration of false information) and Art. 368 (accepting an offer or receiving an undue benefit).

In particular, an episode is being investigated related to a photo published in the media in which Smirnov is flying on a private plane with a number of persons subject to sanctions by the National Security and Defense Council (NABU is investigating who paid for this flight, which was not indicated by Smirnov in the declaration as a gift). Information is also being investigated that Smirnov could have helped with the withdrawal of the assets of these individuals on the eve of the imposition of sanctions on them.

As for illegal enrichment, it is investigating the acquisition of movable and immovable property by Smirnov and his brother in 2020-2023 in the amount of almost 14 million hryvnia.

description: A rare comet, Pons-Brooks, will be visible in the night sky over Russia's mid-latitudes. The comet, which passes by Earth every 100 years, can be seen with binoculars or a small amateur telescope in a dark location with an open horizon.
original:
Forwarded from: IZ.RU
Residents of the mid-latitudes of Russia will be able to see a rare phenomenon - comet Pons-Brooks, which flies over the Earth once every 100 years, astronomer Yaroslav Turilov told Izvestia. “Since the comet is not very bright, you will have to arm yourself with at least binoculars or, even better, a small, amateur telescope “, he said. The scientist noted that the space object can be seen in the night sky, but to do this you will need to be in a “dark place with an open horizon.”

Turilov explained that the comet has a double name due to the fact that it was “discovered twice” - in 1812 it was noticed by the French astronomer Pons, and 70 years later evidence of it appeared again from William Brooks. Subscribe to IZ.RU

event: Terrorist Attack in Crocus City Hall
description: Mikhail Khodorkovsky stated that the public demonstration of torture of detainees following the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall is a dangerous development, aimed at giving security forces a free hand. He believes the regime is trying to scare people, but this will ultimately backfire.
original:
“The demonstration of torture is connected with the desire to give the security forces a free hand.” Khodorkovsky on the air of Dozhd - about the consequences of the terrorist attack in Crocus. The public demonstration of torture of detainees is an additional dangerous accent of the terrorist attack in Crocus City Hall, Mikhail Khodorkovsky said on the air of Dozhd. Such a “shameless, public demonstration of torture” has never happened before, he emphasized. “The shameless demonstration of torture is associated with the desire to give the security forces a free hand. <...> The Kremlin believes that the situation has matured, the regime is not in a very stable position, and it is necessary to scare people to the fullest. But in full - how is it? This is torture.” The terrorist attack at Crocus became an “image failure” for the Russian special services and Putin personally, who shortly before the tragedy called the US Embassy’s message about possible terrorist attacks in Moscow “outright blackmail,” Khodorkovsky says.

In this regard, the Russian authorities are unlikely to be able to use the terrorist attack to justify a possible mobilization or offensive at the front, because the Russians “will immediately remember everything,” Khodorkovsky believes.

At the same time, he believes that the Russian authorities will use the tragedy to “tighten the screws” within the country, expand the practice of torture and increase the number of people convicted on “extremist” charges. event: Forced Issuance of Russian Driver's Licenses
description: Russian forces are forcing Ukrainians in occupied territories to obtain Russian driver's licenses as part of their 'integration' policy. Ukrainian licenses are being confiscated, and residents are required to obtain a Russian passport to renew their certificates. This is an attempt to impose Russian documents on local residents.
original:
Occupiers force Ukrainians to obtain Russian driver's licenses Russia pursues a policy of "integration" of temporarily occupied territories into the Russian Federation.

Currently, in a number of occupied territories, the Russians have begun rounding up drivers who have not yet changed their driver's license to the enemy's. To speed up the process, Ukrainian licenses are taken from drivers as if for inspection and not returned.

At the same time, in order to renew the certificate, it is necessary to obtain a Russian passport, and it is not necessary to undergo re-attestation. That is, the main goal of the process is to impose Russian documents on local residents.

The National Resistance Center notes that Russian road inspectors are as legitimate a target for the Defense Forces as anyone in the service of the occupier. Tell us about the placement of roadblocks and the names of the inspectors of the chatbot so that we can bring them to justice.
